title: Prefigurative Community Building (Part 24): Disability Justice Pods - A Power With Approach to Collective Care
summary: Build peer-organized mutual aid groups centered on radical access, collective care, and the 10 Principles of Disability Justice.

Community.summary: Create peer-led support networks that center disabled leadership and radical accessibility.

resources.label: Sins Invalid – 10 Principles of Disability Justice

level0: Study the 10 Principles of Disability Justice with trusted friends
Start conversations about mutual support with disabled community members
Practice asking about access needs and preferences
level1: Form a small pod with 3-5 trusted people based on consent
Co-create flexible care agreements that can evolve
Establish accessible communication and meeting practices
level2: Rotate support roles to prevent burnout and hierarchy
Hold regular reflection sessions with diverse communication formats
Connect with other disability justice pods for solidarity
level3: Support formation of additional autonomous disability justice pods
Advocate for disability justice principles in broader organizing
Build lasting infrastructure for community-controlled accessibility

Knowledge.summary: Develop and share knowledge about disability justice organizing and radical access practices.

level0: Learn disability justice principles and history
Study existing models like Project LETS and Disability Justice Culture Club
level1: Practice creating access-centered meeting and event spaces
Document your pod's access practices and agreements
level2: Host workshops on disability justice organizing
Create resources about radical access and collective care
level3: Develop comprehensive disability justice organizing toolkits
Research and document impacts of peer-led vs institutional disability services

Narrative.summary: Challenge ableist narratives and promote stories of disabled leadership and interdependence.

level0: Share stories of successful disability justice organizing
Challenge inspiration porn and charity models of disability
level1: Advocate for disability justice principles in community organizing
Write and share experiences of radical access practices
level2: Lead community discussions about ableism and liberation
Create media highlighting disabled leadership and collective care
level3: Contribute to cultural shift toward disability justice as central to all liberation
Mentor others in centering disability justice in organizing
